project_description: A simple Flutter app that switches text between 'Cat' and 'Dog' when clicked, using the Cubit pattern for state management.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modular architecture with separation of concerns. It uses the Cubit pattern for state management, organizing code into distinct folders for screens, cubits, and models.

files.description: Defines AnimalCubit which manages the state of the AnimalScreen.

widgets.description: The main screen that displays the animal text and icon, and toggles between Cat and Dog on tap.

cubits.name: AnimalCubit
cubits.description: Manages the state of the AnimalScreen, toggling between CatState and DogState.

methods.name: toggleAnimal
methods.description: Toggles the animal between Cat and Dog.

models.name: Animal
models.description: Represents an animal with a name and an icon.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> AnimalScreen : taps text
AnimalScreen -> AnimalCubit : toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState : CatState or DogState
AnimalState --> AnimalScreen : updates UI
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using AnimalCubit which toggles between CatState and DogState. User interactions on the AnimalScreen are handled by the Cubit, which emits new states accordingly to update the UI.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen (AnimalScreen) and does not involve any complex navigation.
